answers.answer: I wouldn't worry too much about it because if it's a major concern of yours then I'd talk to your doctor about HRT. The HRT can probably help.

I would recommend seeing a doctor that specializes in bioidentical hormones and menopause.  As we age, we produce less estrogen which is important in preventing vaginal atrophy and lubrication and testosterone which is absolutely key to our libido and all things sexual, our ability to become aroused, our sensitivity and ability/quality of orgasm.I have estrogen and testosterone implants in my hip and I can say they work!There are options and there is no need for you to lose your sex drive.Good luck!
